meanings.definition: A person who holds a viewpoint or interpretation of history before it undergoes revision.
meanings.sent1: The prerevisionists in the class preferred the original version of the story.
meanings.sent2: Historians often study the works of prerevisionists to understand past perspectives.
meanings.sent3: The prerevisionists at the museum argued playfully about which version of the painting was better.
meanings.sent4: She saw the world through the eyes of a prerevisionist, always looking back instead of forward.
meanings.sent5: The prerevisionists' dedication to preserving history was truly admirable.

meanings.definition: The beliefs or theories held by those who advocate for historical interpretations prior to revision.
meanings.sent1: The prerevisionists' ideas sparked interesting debates among scholars.
meanings.sent2: Many students found the writings of prerevisionists to be thought-provoking.
meanings.sent3: The prerevisionists' club met every week to discuss their unique perspectives on history.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a library filled with the diverse thoughts of prerevisionists.
meanings.sent5: The influence of prerevisionists on historical discourse cannot be underestimated.
